key_title: Key to the species of Plagiobothrys

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Boraginaceae

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Boraginaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Boraginaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Sepals 5–9, elongating to c. 9 mm long and becoming unequal, hardened and twisted in fruit, with apices spreading or recurved; mericarps usually 2, closely surrounded by the sepals
Sepals 5, herbaceous or tough, elongating to c. 6 mm but not hardened in fruit, apices remaining erect; mericarps usually 4, loosely sheathed by the sepals
Sepals fused for about one-third of their length; mericarps regularly rectangular- reticulate; stem-hairs spreading
Sepals almost entirely free, fused only at very base; mericarps coarsely and irregu- larly reticulate; stem-hairs appressed
